description: Notification of Alarm Event received by OMC
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmEvent OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmObjectClass s EXAMPLE OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmObjectInstance s EXAMPLE OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmSeverity i 0 OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmProbableCause s EXAMPLE OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmSpecificProblem s EXAMPLE OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmEventTime u 9999 OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmEventType i 0 OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmNotificationID i 9999 OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmCorrelatedIDs s EXAMPLE OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmThreshold s EXAMPLE OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmTrending i 0 OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmAdditionalText s EXAMPLE OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmRepairAction s EXAMPLE

description: Managed Object Class
variables.name: OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmObjectClass

description: Managed Object Istance Identifier
variables.name: OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmObjectInstance

description: enumeration of severity levels
variables.name: OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmSeverity

description: Probable Cause identifier, for causes from M3100 standard, the value will be integer, e.g. 1 which is equivalent to AIS. For X.721 local alarms, the value will be a string, e.g. arfProbableCuase.1 which is defined as Adapter Error. For X.721 global alarms, the value is an integer equal to 5640 or greater, e.g. 5640 which is Enclosure Door Open. Finally for GSM alarms, the value will be of type string like the following gsm1211PC.3 which is Antenna Problem.
variables.name: OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmProbableCause

description: Specific Problem
variables.name: OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmSpecificProblem

description: Event time in number of seconds since 00:00:00 UTC, January 1, 1970
variables.name: OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmEventTime

description: Represents the event type values for the alarms as per [X.733] and [X.736]
variables.name: OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmEventType

description: Unique integer identifier for this alarm per Network Element
variables.name: OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmNotificationID

description: A String of correlated notification IDs listed as a comma delimited list of omcAlarmNotificationIDs, e.g. 3, 5
variables.name: OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmCorrelatedIDs

description: Alarm Thresholding information
variables.name: OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmThreshold

description: Alarm Trending information
variables.name: OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmTrending

description: Alarm Additional Text
variables.name: OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmAdditionalText

description: Proposed Repair Actions
variables.name: OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmRepairAction

description: Notification of alarm that was manually cleared

event.Summary: OMC alarm manually cleared. Action Host: $v5; $v7

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcManualClearEvent OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmObjectClass s EXAMPLE OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmObjectInstance s EXAMPLE OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmNotificationID i 9999 OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmActionResult i 0 OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmActionHost s EXAMPLE OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmActionUser s EXAMPLE OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmActionText s EXAMPLE OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmActionTime u 9999

description: Managed Object Class
variables.name: OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmObjectClass

description: Managed Object Istance Identifier
variables.name: OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmObjectInstance

description: Unique integer identifier for this alarm per Network Element
variables.name: OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmNotificationID

description: If set, means this is a manual clear notification
variables.name: OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmActionResult

description: If set, hostname of the machine which invoked manual clear
variables.name: OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmActionHost

description: If set, OMC user name who invoked manual clear
variables.name: OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmActionUser

description: If set, any action text the user entered when invoking manual clear
variables.name: OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmActionText

description: If set, the manual clear time in seconds since 00:00:00 UTC, January 1, 1970
variables.name: OMC-ALARM-MIB::omcAlarmActionTime
